first_reading.text:
[[Rm 1,16]]Brothers and sisters: I am not ashamed of the Gospel. It is the power of God for the salvation of everyone who believes: for Jew first, and then Greek.
[[Rm 1,17]]For in it is revealed the righteousness of God from faith to faith; as it is written, "The one who is righteous by faith will live."
[[Rm 1,18]]The wrath of God is indeed being revealed from heaven against every impiety and wickedness of those who suppress the truth by their wickedness.
[[Rm 1,19]]For what can be known about God is evident to them, because God made it evident to them.
[[Rm 1,20]]Ever since the creation of the world, his invisible attributes of eternal power and divinity have been able to be understood and perceived in what he has made. As a result, they have no excuse;
[[Rm 1,21]]for although they knew God they did not accord him glory as God or give him thanks. Instead, they became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless minds were darkened.
[[Rm 1,22]]While claiming to be wise, they became fools
[[Rm 1,23]]and exchanged the glory of the immortal God for the likeness of an image of mortal man or of birds or of four-legged animals or of snakes.
[[Rm 1,24]]Therefore, God handed them over to impurity through the lusts of their hearts for the mutual degradation of their bodies.
[[Rm 1,25]]They exchanged the truth of God for a lie and revered and worshiped the creature rather than the creator, who is blessed forever. Amen.
first_reading.title: Letter to the Romans

psalm.text:
[[Ps 19,2]]The heavens declare the glory of God; 
and the firmament proclaims his handiwork.
[[Ps 19,3]]Day pours out the word to day, 
and night to night imparts knowledge.

[[Ps 19,4]]Not a word nor a discourse 
whose voice is not heard;
[[Ps 19,5]]Through all the earth their voice resounds, 
and to the ends of the world, their message.
psalm.title: Psalms

gospel.text:
[[Lc 11,37]]After Jesus had spoken, a Pharisee invited him to dine at his home. He entered and reclined at table to eat.
[[Lc 11,38]]The Pharisee was amazed to see that he did not observe the prescribed washing before the meal.
[[Lc 11,39]]The Lord said to him, "Oh you Pharisees! Although you cleanse the outside of the cup and the dish, inside you are filled with plunder and evil.
[[Lc 11,40]]You fools! Did not the maker of the outside also make the inside?
[[Lc 11,41]]But as to what is within, give alms, and behold, everything will be clean for you."
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke
